snippet: Turkey, which has been supporting the Syrian opposition to President Bashar al-Assad, has been worried that it was vulnerable to Syrian missiles.
abstract: United States plans to send two Patriot missile batteries and 400 military personnel to Turkey to defend against possible Syrian missile attack; batteries will be part of broader NATO push to expand Turkey's defenses; Turkey has been worried it is vulnerable to Syrian missiles due to its support of Syrian opposition to Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL R. GORDON

lead_paragraph: Turkey, which has been supporting the Syrian opposition to President Bashar al-Assad, has been worried that it was vulnerable to Syrian missiles.

headline.seo: U.S. to Send 2 Missiles Batteries to Turkey to Deter Syria
headline.main: U.S. to Send 2 Missile Units to Turkey to Deter Syrians
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Send 2 Missile Units To Turkey to Deter Syrians
